author: Special Correspondent
text:
A soldier was killed and another is missing after an avalanche hit an Army patrol party in the Ladakh region of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday.

Defence spokesman Colonel N.N. Joshi said the Army patrol in Turtuk area of Ladakh, at more that 10,000 feet, was hit by an avalanche around 8 a.m. “Two soldiers were buried under the snow. One soldier was brought out in the immediate rescue drills, while another continues to be missing,” he said.

The rescued soldier, Lance Havildar Bhawan Tamang, however, died in the hospital. Tamang hailed from Lopshu village in Darjeeling, in West Bengal.

15 deaths this year

With this, the death toll of soldiers in avalanches this year has reached 15.

On January 3, four Army personnel died after an avalanche hit the country’s highest military installation at an altitude of 5,753 metres in Ladakh’s Siachen glacier. On February 3, avalanches in the area left 10 soldiers dead. On March 20, another solider died in Kargil sector.
title: Soldier killed in Ladakh avalanche, one missing
